segment.source: Apps in Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)
segment.target: Apps in Windows Store for Business (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows Store for Business has thousands of apps from many different categories.
segment.target: Windows Store for Business has thousands of apps from many different categories.

segment.source: Apps in Windows Store for Business
segment.target: Apps in Windows Store for Business

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Windows Store for Business has thousands of apps from many different categories.
segment.target: Windows Store for Business has thousands of apps from many different categories.

segment.source: These app types are supported in Store for Business:
segment.target: These app types are supported in Store for Business:

segment.source: Universal Windows apps for Windows 10
segment.target: Universal Windows apps for Windows 10

segment.source: Universal Windows apps, by device: phone, Surface Hub, IoT, HoloLens
segment.target: Universal Windows apps, by device: phone, Surface Hub, IoT, HoloLens

segment.source: Apps in your inventory will have at least one of these supported platforms listed for the app:
segment.target: Apps in your inventory will have at least one of these supported platforms listed for the app:

segment.source: Windows 10 desktops
segment.target: Windows 10 desktops

segment.source: Windows 10 phones
segment.target: Windows 10 phones

segment.source: Windows 10 xbox
segment.target: Windows 10 xbox

segment.source: Windows 10 IOT devices
segment.target: Windows 10 IOT devices

segment.source: Windows 10 servers
segment.target: Windows 10 servers

segment.source: Windows 10 all devices
segment.target: Windows 10 all devices

segment.source: Windows 10 Surface Hub
segment.target: Windows 10 Surface Hub

segment.source: Windows 10 HoloLens
segment.target: Windows 10 HoloLens

segment.source: Apps that you acquire from the Store for Business only work on Windows 10-based devices.
segment.target: Apps that you acquire from the Store for Business only work on Windows 10-based devices.

segment.source: Even though an app might list Windows 8 as its supported platform, that tells you what platform the app was originally written for.
segment.target: Even though an app might list Windows 8 as its supported platform, that tells you what platform the app was originally written for.

segment.source: Apps developed for Windows 8, or Windows phone 8 will work on Windows 10.
segment.target: Apps developed for Windows 8, or Windows phone 8 will work on Windows 10.

segment.source: Some apps are free, and some apps charge a price.
segment.target: Some apps are free, and some apps charge a price.

segment.source: Currently, you can pay for apps with a credit card.
segment.target: Currently, you can pay for apps with a credit card.

segment.source: We'll be adding more payment options over time.
segment.target: We'll be adding more payment options over time.

segment.source: Some apps which are available to consumers in the Windows Store might not be available to organizations in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Some apps which are available to consumers in the Windows Store might not be available to organizations in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: App developers can opt-out their apps, and they also need to meet eligibility requirements for Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: App developers can opt-out their apps, and they also need to meet eligibility requirements for Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: For more information, read this info on Organizational licensing options.
segment.target: For more information, read this info on Organizational licensing options.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: We are still setting up the catalog of apps for Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: We are still setting up the catalog of apps for Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: If you are searching for an app and it isn’t available, please check again in a couple of days.
segment.target: If you are searching for an app and it isn’t available, please check again in a couple of days.

segment.source: Line-of-business (LOB) apps are also supported using the Store for Business.
segment.target: Line-of-business (LOB) apps are also supported using the Store for Business.

segment.source: Admins can invite IT devs and ISVs to be LOB publishers.
segment.target: Admins can invite IT devs and ISVs to be LOB publishers.

segment.source: Apps developed by your LOB publishers that are submitted to the Store are only available to your organization.
segment.target: Apps developed by your LOB publishers that are submitted to the Store are only available to your organization.

segment.source: Once an administrator accepts an app submitted by one of their LOB publishers, the app can be distributed just like any other app from Store for Business.
segment.target: Once an administrator accepts an app submitted by one of their LOB publishers, the app can be distributed just like any other app from Store for Business.

segment.source: For more information, see Working with Line-of-Business apps.
segment.target: For more information, see Working with Line-of-Business apps.

segment.source: In-app purchases
segment.target: In-app purchases

segment.source: Some apps offer you the option to make in-app purchases.
segment.target: Some apps offer you the option to make in-app purchases.

segment.source: In-app purchases are not currently supported for apps that are acquired through Store for Business and distributed to employees.
segment.target: In-app purchases are not currently supported for apps that are acquired through Store for Business and distributed to employees.

segment.source: If an employee makes an in-app purchase, they'll make it with their personal Microsoft account and pay for it with a personal payment method.
segment.target: If an employee makes an in-app purchase, they'll make it with their personal Microsoft account and pay for it with a personal payment method.

segment.source: The employee will own the item purchased, and it cannot be transferred to your organization’s inventory.
segment.target: The employee will own the item purchased, and it cannot be transferred to your organization’s inventory.

segment.source: Licensing model: online and offline licenses
segment.target: Licensing model: online and offline licenses

segment.source: Store for Business supports two options to license apps: online and offline.
segment.target: Store for Business supports two options to license apps: online and offline.

segment.source: Online licensing is the default licensing model and is similar to the Windows Store.
segment.target: Online licensing is the default licensing model and is similar to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Online licensed apps require users and devices to connect to the Store for Business service to acquire an app and its license.
segment.target: Online licensed apps require users and devices to connect to the Store for Business service to acquire an app and its license.

segment.source: Licensing management is enforced based on the user’s Azure AD identity and maintained by the store as well as the management tool.
segment.target: Licensing management is enforced based on the user’s Azure AD identity and maintained by the store as well as the management tool.

segment.source: By default app updates are handled by Windows Update.
segment.target: By default app updates are handled by Windows Update.

segment.source: Distribution options for online-licensed apps include the ability to:
segment.target: Distribution options for online-licensed apps include the ability to:

segment.source: Assign an app to employees.
segment.target: Assign an app to employees.

segment.source: Add an app to your private store, allowing employees to download the app.
segment.target: Add an app to your private store, allowing employees to download the app.

segment.source: Distribute through a management tool.
segment.target: Distribute through a management tool.

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.
segment.target: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.

segment.source: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.
segment.target: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.

segment.source: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in Store for Business.
segment.target: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in Store for Business.

segment.source: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
segment.target: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.

segment.source: You have the following distribution options for offline-licensed apps:
segment.target: You have the following distribution options for offline-licensed apps:

segment.source: Include the app in a provisioning package, and then use it as part of imaging a device.
segment.target: Include the app in a provisioning package, and then use it as part of imaging a device.

segment.source: Distribute the app through a management tool.
segment.target: Distribute the app through a management tool.

segment.source: For more information, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Store for Business.
